image.altText: Rishi Sunak speaks on a stage.

props.synopsis: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has conceded defeat in the country's general election, with Labour's Keir Starmer set to form government on the back of a landslide win. Follow live.

title.children: Rishi Sunak holds on to seat but acknowledges Labour win in UK election

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rishi Sunak: 'Today power will change hands in a peaceful and orderly manner'

image.altText: A close-up shot of a person's hands holding a set of silver house keys.

props.synopsis: The Canberra couple were awarded $1,500 in non-economic damages after a real estate agent entered their bedroom while the wife was in bed asleep with her infant son.

title.children: Canberra couple awarded damages after wife awoken by a real estate agent in her bedroom conducting an inspection

image.altText: outside view of federal court in australia

props.synopsis: Leith Dawes takes the office of the ACT's Work Health and Safety Commissioner to the Federal Circuit Court, alleging a breach of general workplace protections.

title.children: Former WorkSafe ACT employee asks for $400,000 in compensation, arguing he was unfairly sacked

image.altText: Watercolour graphic of a building that looks like a school with a playground out the front.

props.synopsis: Parents and former educators at Guardian Childcare and Education in Canberra tell the ABC about instances where children were forgotten outside, served mouldy bread and spoiled food, narrowly escaped anaphylactic reactions, and returned home in soiled nappies.

title.children: Families and staff speak out about safety concerns at Guardian childcare centres in Canberra

image.altText: A man stands behind a lectern inside in front of a red banner that says '5 missions for a better future'

props.synopsis: Amid a period of global instability, the apparent Labour landslide shows the UK has lurched to the centre-left while much of Europe is moving to the right. Two major stories are now emerging.

title.children: Two major stories explain the rise of Labour in the UK: the first is Britons' disillusionment with the Tories

image.altText: A closeup shot of the prime minister looking sombre, wearing glasses and frowning

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says faith-based political parties would undermine social cohesion in Australia, after revelations this week that The Muslim Vote movement was planning to target federal seats at the next election.

title.children: Faith-based political parties would 'undermine social cohesion', PM says

image.altText: Jill Biden wears a pink suit with a pin that says BIDEN on the collar.

props.synopsis: In the past few days, spotlights have narrowed and focused on one face above others: Jill Biden. Will she do what is right for her husband, the country? And what will this mean?

title.children: Jill Biden once used bikini diplomacy to discourage her husband from a presidential run. How should she use her influence now?

image.altText: Two text bubbles with messages like "You played really well today mate!"

props.synopsis: A former Tasmanian cop repeatedly groomed boys over his decades-long career. A report into Paul Reynolds has outlined how he used his standing in the community to do it.

title.children: 'The funniest bloke I've ever met': How paedophile police officer Paul Reynolds groomed an entire community

image.altText: Troy Smith sits in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Troy Smith, who was arrested in April after police found methamphetamine in his hotel room in Bali, is sentenced to six-month drug rehabilitation by an Indonesian court.

title.children: Australian man sentenced to rehabilitation in Indonesia after possessing drugs in Bali

image.altText: A man and a woman walk along a yellow sand beach and colourful umbrellas dot the shore.

props.synopsis: Sri Lanka has been rocked by a series of crises in the past two decades but locals are now urging tourists to return and enjoy its sights.

title.children: Sri Lanka suffered a catastrophic economic crisis, but is it safe to travel there?

image.altText: Hand of man inserting a power cord into an electric car

props.synopsis: Car buyers looking for low-emission options are choosing hybrid vehicles over fully battery-powered EVs, according to latest sales figures.

title.children: A surge in hybrid sales has surprised automakers and sounded alarm for emissions

image.altText: A man in a suit smiling and looking on, seen from close up.

props.synopsis: They were criticised for their "cautious" strategy, but Sir Keir Starmer and Labour orchestrated a landslide victory through being the "least unpopular" options.

title.children: Polls said Keir Starmer was 'incompetent'. But he won the UK election anyway

image.altText: A man and a woman walk out of a building smiling, with electoral signs also visible

props.synopsis: Britain's ruling Conservative Party has been thrown out of government after 14 years, with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak conceding defeat and saying voters had delivered a "sobering verdict".

title.children: 'It's now time for us to deliver': British PM-in-waiting speaks as Tory rout could be 'worst in history'

image.altText: Joe Biden in black and white against a red blue gradient speaking at a podiumj

props.synopsis: As the race to become president of the United States continues to heat up, members of the Democratic party fear for their leader Joe Biden.

title.children: Insiders say two dozen high profile Democrats are ready to ask Biden to step aside. Has 'the dam broken'?

image.altText: Tennis player Andy Murray stands on Centre Court at Wimbledon, with arms raised acknowledging the crowd.

props.synopsis: All the emotions come out at Wimbledon on day four, with Aussies spoiling the Murray party, Thanasi Kokkinakis fearing the worst after another injury, while American Taylor Fritz fires up at an opponent after his victory.

title.children: Five quick hits — Aussies spoil the Murray party, Kokkinakis fearing the worst, Fritz gives opponent a send-off after win

image.altText: Cathy Freeman celebrates 400m victory

props.synopsis: NAIDOC Week celebrations officially begin on Sunday with the theme: Keep the fire burning! Blak, Loud and Proud. But can everyone celebrate?

title.children: First Nations heroes are celebrated this NAIDOC Week

image.altText: Senator Fatima Payman stands in front of a media pack in Parliament House to announce she's quitting the Labor Party.

props.synopsis: Senator Fatima Payman announced that she quit the Labor Party and will be running as an independent.

title.children: Labor calls for Senator Payman to quit, but in the meantime they may need her vote

image.altText: A woman on a red carpet with a black and red sparkly dress

props.synopsis: The Essex security guard meticulously planned how he would kidnap the This Morning presenter from her home — even going as far as to purchase a kidnap kit for the purpose.

title.children: Man convicted of plotting to kidnap, rape and murder UK television presenter Holly Willoughby

image.altText: A composite image with a photo of Donald Trump, a gorilla statue and a female athlete kayaking

props.synopsis: Think you've kept a keen eye on the news cycle this week? Test yourself!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A Trump ruling, Garry the missing gorilla and an Olympic feat

image.altText: A girl sitting cross-legged looking at her phone with a worried look on her face; and her forehead in the palm of her hand

props.synopsis: Experts think exposure to traumatic content on social media, such as uncensored images coming out of the Middle East, can give some people PTSD. So what signs should you look out for, and how can you protect yourself?

title.children: Stuck in a doomscrolling dive? Here are signs of 'vicarious trauma' to watch out for

image.altText: A gas flare

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading lower on Friday, while a report by the ACCC has warned that the eastern states could face a gas shortfall by 2027 — a year earlier than it had previously predicted. Follow live.

title.children: ACCC warns east coast could face gas shortfalls by 2027, ASX lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PayPal Australia's 'unfair' term in small business contracts
Will oil prices continue to climb?

image.altText: A graphic showing a St Vincent's hospital and nib logos side by side, separated by ripped paper

props.synopsis: St Vincent's is planning to end its contract with private health insurer nib after negotiations for renewal broke down.

title.children: 'First time in 167 years': Hospital chain flags shock split from major health insurer

image.altText: Taylan May wears headphones

props.synopsis: Centre Taylan May has parted company with Penrith, bringing to a close a bitter backroom feud between the NRL club and the troubled player.

title.children: Penrith Panthers release controversial centre Taylan May

image.altText: A blonde woman in a boat captains uniform smiles with her arms crossed

props.synopsis: All aboard with the strong-willed captain of Below Deck: Mediterranean for a rapid-fire round of questions, silly and serious.

title.children: Captain Sandy Yawn on the moments you don't get to see on Below Deck: Mediterranean

image.altText: woman with bandaged face and tube in her mouth

props.synopsis: Newcastle woman Rebecca Ode's family is seeking answers after she lost an eye and had 14 hours of surgery for a brain haemorrhage, shattered eye socket and cheekbone after a mystery incident in Bali.

title.children: Mystery as Australian woman suffers life-changing head injuries in Bali and family fights to get her home

image.altText: two public housing towers can be seen with the Melbourne city skyline in the background

props.synopsis: Rent for the vast majority of public housing tenants in Victoria is capped according to income, but advocates say sharp increases in market rents before rebates are applied are causing confusion and concern.

title.children: 'Something deeply wrong' as market value of Victoria's public housing properties soars

image.altText: A tall ship passing a mountainous island.

props.synopsis: A group of young sailors spending their school holidays on an eight-day tall ship voyage have helped pluck two stranded kayakers from dangerous waters near Hinchinbrook Island.

title.children: Teens aboard tall ship rescue capsized kayaker from crocodile-prone Queensland waters

image.altText: A woman with a blonde pony sits on a grassy knoll looking away from the camera to the ocean below.

props.synopsis: After three decades of living with weaponised incompetence, the final straw was coming home from holiday without a single picture of myself in our camera roll.

title.children: 'I'm not sharing a house with a man again': Weaponised incompetence ended Adelle's marriage

image.altText: A phot of an Indigenous man looking directly at the camera with Indigenous mural in background.

props.synopsis: With election day just months away in the Northern Territory, a prominent Indigenous leader is calling on politicians — and the media — to change the narrative around Aboriginal people.

title.children: 'Uncivilised, lazy, violent': Arrernte leader says narratives around Aboriginal people in Alice Springs must change

image.altText: A person unfurls a large Chinese flag at a stadium, many photographers are seen in the background

props.synopsis: Weeks before the Paris Olympics, World Aquatics confirms a US criminal investigation is underway into the cases of 23 Chinese swimmers who failed doping tests in 2021 but were allowed to continue competing.

title.children: US federal investigation opens into 2021 Chinese doping cases in run-up to Olympics

image.altText: Eddie Murphy looking serious and pointing a gun with both hands, palm trees behind him

props.synopsis: Mark Molloy moved to LA a decade ago to pursue his dream of directing a Hollywood feature film. But it was an advertisement he made that helped him score his debut: directing one of the world's biggest stars in the reboot of Beverly Hills Cop.

title.children: How a boy from Ballarat wound up pitching himself to Eddie Murphy to direct the new Beverly Hills Cop

image.altText: Four king penguins on a wide pebbly expanse in front of icy mountains. Two are standing, one is lying down and one is grooming

props.synopsis: The marine park that includes the subantarctic Heard and McDonald Islands is set for a massive expansion, with the federal government planning to protect an extra 300,000 square kilometres of ocean.

title.children: Government flags massive expansion of Antarctic marine park for 'untouched' Heard and McDonald Islands
